intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: *Huff, huff* Why do mountains... have to... be so steep?

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: Thank you, Olivia. You're a lifesaver.

intro.speaker: Olivia
intro.line: Oh, hardly. I just flail around and pretend to dance, mostly. Anyway, I've started looking for new ways to be useful.

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: Your dancing is spectacular! It never fails to pick me up.

intro.speaker: Olivia
intro.line: Ha! I dance like a ham someone rolled down the stairs. Just thinking of people watching me makes me cringe...

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: We're near the bandit's camp, Robin. They've ravaged surrounding towns with impunity for too long. It ends today.

intro.speaker: Inigo
intro.line: The crying part is over, love. Now give us a smile. And perhaps a wink if a fellow can be greedy?

intro.speaker: Maiden
intro.line: Inigo, you stupid fool! That bandit you slew has---

intro.speaker: Inigo
intro.line: Dozens of friends who will be terribly cross with me? Aye. Worry not! I'll mop up the lot of them and be back in time for tea.

intro.speaker: Inigo
intro.line: Ho ho! Don't be silly. I'd never let anyone ruin this perfect face. Surely you want them gone as well, yes? So that you may rebuild in peace?

intro.speaker: Inigo
intro.line: Then let us have no more frowns! A smile like yours is not a treasure to be locked in the king's dungeons! I'll meet you in town once I've sorted those pesky bandits. Perhaps then we can discuss my... reward. Ho ho!

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: Their hold is just ahead. It should be... Wait, what's that? Gods, that man is fighting them alone. Come, let's lend him a hand!

recruit-talk.speaker: Olivia
recruit-talk.line: Are... Are you all right?

recruit-talk.speaker: Inigo
recruit-talk.line: ...GYAAARRGH!

recruit-talk.speaker: Olivia
recruit-talk.line: EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEK! Wh-what's wrong?!

recruit-talk.speaker: Inigo
recruit-talk.line: S-sorry! ...Sorry. You just surprised me.

recruit-talk.speaker: Olivia
recruit-talk.line: I'd say we're even on that count!

recruit-talk.speaker: Inigo
recruit-talk.line: I shouldn't have shouted, but... Er, yes. Can we please start over? ...Ahem! It was your ravishing beauty that caught me so off guard, milady!

recruit-talk.speaker: Olivia
recruit-talk.line: I don't quite know how to reply to that!

recruit-talk.speaker: Inigo
recruit-talk.line: Er, please don't look at me so...intently. It makes me terribly bashful.

recruit-talk.speaker: Olivia
recruit-talk.line: What?! W-wait! Don't go! Drat he's gone. He totally stole my line, too. Still it's weird, I didn't have a problem talking to him. Maybe his shyness countered my own?

recruit-talk.speaker: Inigo
recruit-talk.line: Well, then. I should think five kills would be enough to impress a simple village girl. Though six might earn me a sweet kiss... Hmmm... That IS tempting.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: You all right?

recruit-talk.speaker: Inigo
recruit-talk.line: Me? Hah! It takes more than that to wound a rogue this charming! Now then, who are you? Not an enemy, it seems?

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: I'm Chrom, leader of the Shepherds. We came to deal with bandits, so it appears our purpose is shared.

recruit-talk.speaker: Inigo
recruit-talk.line: Chrom?! Then you're Lucina's...

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: What's that?

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: What?

recruit-talk.speaker: Inigo
recruit-talk.line: P-please don't stare at me like that. I get so...terribly shy.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Aren't you the one who's been staring at me? And why did that line seem so familiar?

recruit-talk.speaker: Inigo
recruit-talk.line: Er, but yes! We share a common foe, and I'm grateful for the help. Can I trust you to defend this place?

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: I don't know. What are you planning?

recruit-talk.speaker: Inigo
recruit-talk.line: I aim to crush the rascals who make trouble for the village, naturally! And once the lot of them are sorted, it's off to tea with a beauty of the fields. Heh heh heh... Right then! If that's decided, I'll be on my way. Put the kettle on, snookums! I won't be long now!

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: He's nothing if not eager...

recruit-talk.speaker: Inigo
recruit-talk.line: Well, then. I should think five kills would be enough to impress a simple village girl. Though six might earn me a sweet kiss... Hmmm... That IS tempting.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: You all right?

recruit-talk.speaker: Inigo
recruit-talk.line: Me? Hah! It takes more then that to wound a rogue this charming! Now then, who are you? Not an enemy, it seems.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: I'm Chrom, leader of the Shepherds. We came to deal with the bandits, so it appears our purpose is shared.

recruit-talk.speaker: Inigo
recruit-talk.line: Chrom?! Then you...You're my father.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: What? You, too?!

recruit-talk.speaker: Inigo
recruit-talk.line: Then you've already met Lucina?!

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Yes, she's with us now.

recruit-talk.speaker: Inigo
recruit-talk.line: Oh, good. She was so terribly eager to see you! Ah, but forgive me. I still haven't introduced myself. I am Inigo, Lucina's younger brother and a crown prince of Ylisse myself. If you need further proof, I bear a Brand in the opposite eye as Lucina.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Hmm...Yep. That's a Brand all right.

recruit-talk.speaker: Inigo
recruit-talk.line: Um, could I ask you to stop staring now? I get a bit...bashful.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Ah, right. Sorry

recruit-talk.speaker: Inigo
recruit-talk.line: Aha ha! Not to worry. Now, then. It's back into the fray with me, Father. Then it's off for tea with a farm girl! ...And perhaps a bit more. Don't wait up! Aha ha ha!

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Oh gods. I raised a philanderer. ...Well, he seems content enough. Heh. A son. Who knew?

recruit-talk.speaker: Inigo
recruit-talk.line: Well, then. I should think five kills would be enough to impress a simple village girl. Though six might earn me a sweet kiss... Hmm... That IS tempting...

boss.speaker: Jamil
boss.line: All who defy the will of Grima will be purged in the flames of destruction!

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: That's the last of the bandits. The hold is reclaimed.

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: The villagers will sleep better for our good works, milord.

end.speaker: Maiden
end.line: I can't begin to thank you, good sir

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Actually, Inigo did most of the heavy lifting on this one.

end.speaker: Maiden
end.line: He is so terribly brave... Part of me wishes I could have been there to witness it. Er, but yes. Please accept this gift from all us villagers.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Your kindness flatters me. If bandits ever trouble you again, you need but call and we'll come running. Rebuilding a town is hard work, but I trust you'll be just fine.

end.speaker: Maiden
end.line: We'll do our best!

end.speaker: Inigo
end.line: Um... Olivia? Might I have a moment?

end.speaker: Olivia
end.line: Wh-what? With me? Why?! ...Wait, how did you know my name?

end.speaker: Inigo
end.line: A little bird tweeted it out. So is that a yes?

end.speaker: Olivia
end.line: Um, all right, I guess.

end.speaker: Inigo
end.line: ...Er, yes. You see... What I mean to say is... Goodness, this is much harder than chatting up other girls I've met. I suppose it would be quickest to just show you this...

end.speaker: Olivia
end.line: M-my ring? But... I'm wearing it! How did you...?

end.speaker: Inigo
end.line: Indeed. How does Inigo have your ring when there is only one in all the world? Unless it IS your ring and I brought it back from the future!

end.speaker: Olivia
end.line: What? You mean like Lucina...?

end.speaker: Inigo
end.line: Exactly. I knew my mother was a dancer you see. So I've been scouring the land looking for all the dancers I could find. Not the worst job in the world, mind. Heh heh heh... But now I've finally found you Mother! And my dancing is all the better for it!

end.speaker: Olivia
end.line: Oh! You dance?

end.speaker: Inigo
end.line: Er sort of, yes. That is to say, I try my best. But some people don't appreciate male dancers. Not that I care! I'm content to just shake my hips for the ladies.

end.speaker: Olivia
end.line: Oh, don't listen to them! I think it's wonderful. I'd... love to watch you dance sometime.

end.speaker: Inigo
end.line: N-no! Impossible! I'd be far too embarrassed for that! Besides, I'd rather watch you dance.

end.speaker: Olivia
end.line: What?! N-no! I couldn't possibly!

end.speaker: Inigo
end.line: I'm shyer than you are, Mother!

end.speaker: Olivia
end.line: You are not!

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Would you two stop it already? Now I'm the one who's getting embarrassed...

end.speaker: Inigo
end.line: At last, teatime has arrived!

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: We're leaving, Inigo.

end.speaker: Inigo
end.line: What, right now? B-but... teatime!

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: War is hell, Inigo. Now come with us or be left behind.

end.speaker: Inigo
end.line: Fine, fine! I'm coming. ...I suppose there'll be more buttercups blooming along the road ahead.
